title: French business leaders' uninhibited anger against taxes and regulations
summary: Emmanuel Macron's business-friendly policies have disappeared with the dissolution of the Assemblée Nationale and government instability. Among the most outspoken CEOs is Bernard Arnault, president of LVMH.

title: Trump White House confirms Canada, Mexico and China tariffs to enter into force on Saturday
summary: Starting on Saturday, February 1, products coming from Canada and Mexico will be affected by 25% customs duties and those imported from China will see tariffs rise by 10%. Trump warned that the EU is next: 'You want the truthful answer or shall I give you a political answer? Absolutely. The European Union has treated us so terribly,' he told reporters Friday in the Oval Office.

title: Growth: Europe continues to lag behind the US
summary: US gross domestic product grew by 2.8% in 2024, compared with just 0.7% in the Eurozone. Plagued by structural weaknesses and high energy costs, Europe is being led by the US in terms of growth, competitiveness and innovation.

title: Dupont shines as France overwhelms Wales 43-0 in Six Nations opener
summary: Antoine Dupont was back at the Six Nations after his successful sevens sabbatical, with France leading 28-0 at the break. Wales failed to score a point in the competition for the first time in 27 years.

title: Toward a new definition of obesity, beyond body mass index
summary: Is obesity a disease? How could it be better defined? A commission of 56 global experts from 'The Lancet' magazine has set out to define obesity, notably by distinguishing between preclinical and clinical cases.

title: Olympic balloon to return to Paris every summer up to LA Games
summary: President Emmanuel Macron said on Friday that one of the most popular symbols of last summer's Olympics will be back until 2028.

title: How expensive is the Louvre compared to other major art museums in the world?
summary: The standard price for one ticket to the permanent collections of the Louvre is €22, although free admission is still offered to job seekers, disabled visitors, and European residents 25 years old and under.

title: After five days of fighting, the situation in Goma is uncertain
summary: The residents of the capital of North Kivu province, which fell into the hands of the M23 rebel group, backed by the Rwandan army, have been anxiously rediscovering the state of their town under rebel control.

title: Germany: MPs reject immigration bill from right and far right
summary: After the conservative CDU-CSU bloc joined with the far-right Alternative für Deutschland party to pass a non-binding motion cracking down on immigration on Wednesday, MPs voted 338-350 to reject a bill on the issue.

title: Germany's Bundestag debates banning far-right AfD party
summary: A cross-party group of 124 MPs put a motion on the agenda to bring proceedings before the Federal Constitutional Court to ban the party, whose unprecedented alliance with the CDU caused a shock.

title: Latest Israeli hostage and Palestinian prisoner release highlights truce fragility
summary: Talks on a 'permanent' ceasefire between Israel and Hamas are set to resume on Friday, 16 days after the temporary halt in fighting, with an implementation planned for late February.

title: Kash Patel and Tulsi Gabbard, Trump's controversial nominees for FBI and intelligence face Senate scrutiny
summary: During their respective hearings, Kash Patel and Tulsi Gabbard promised to restore trust. However, they were chosen above all for one reason: their willingness to bend the FBI and the intelligence services to Trump's will.

title: Peru wins a round in its battle with Chile for pisco's heritage
summary: At the end of 2024, UNESCO acknowledged the authenticity of manuscripts dating back to the Spanish colonial period, which mention grape alcohol production in the Andean country as early as the 16th century. This provides an opportunity to reignite a cultural and commercial battle with Chile, which also lays claim to the designation.

title: A valuable portrait of George Washington at Princeton will be restored at Versailles
summary: The Centre de Recherche et de Restauration des Musées de France has been commissioned to restore the 1779 painting from the US embassy to its original glory.

title: In Germany, 'economic stagnation threatens the very core of collective identity'
summary: German economist Max Krahé describes the 'mid-life crisis' affecting the German economy, whose growth model depends on exports.

title: Jean-Marie Le Pen's grave vandalized
summary: An image posted by one of the daughters of the former far-right leader, who died in January, showed that the stone cross adorning the grave had been smashed into pieces.

title: Haiti's transitional president Leslie Voltaire announces November 2025 elections
summary: During a visit to the Elysée on Wednesday, the president of Haiti's Transitional Presidential Council promised to hold elections in November and to inaugurate an elected government by February 2026. The country's last elections were held in 2016.

title: Black boxes recovered from DC plane crash that killed 67 people
summary: An American Airlines flight from Kansas, carrying 60 passengers and four crew members, collided with a US military helicopter with three people aboard on Wednesday night. There were no survivors. The flight data and cockpit voice recorders have been recovered from the passenger jet.

title: Venezuela frees 6 Americans after meeting between Maduro and Trump's envoy
summary: US President Donald Trump and his envoy for special missions, Richard Grenell, announced the release of the six men on social media. Grenell's hours-long trip to Venezuela, according to the White House, was focused on Trump's efforts to deport Venezuelans back to their home country.

title: Those affected by pollution demand that Ursula von der Leyen 'Ban PFAs now'
summary: Communities and residents of polluted sites have been mobilizing across Europe in recent days in response to revelations by 'Le Monde' and its partners concerning the cost of failing to take action against 'forever chemicals.'

title: Five places to practice yoga with your family in and around Paris
summary: At the entrance to Beaubourg, in the heart of Orsay, between the statues of the Musée Guimet or in a more classical studio: You can introduce your children to yoga almost anywhere!

title: 'Heartbreaking' search for those killed in DC air crash: 'We're working as fast as we can'
summary: The remains of 41 people had been pulled from the river as of Friday afternoon, including 28 that had been positively identified, Washington, DC, Fire Chief John Donnelly Sr said at a news conference. He said next of kin notifications had been made to 18 families, and he expects all the remains to be recovered.

title: Unofficial presidential campaign gets underway in Ukraine
summary: Although the public supports postponing the presidential and parliamentary elections that were supposed to take place in 2024, Volodymyr Zelensky's popularity rating has declined and his rivals are already positioning themselves for the next round.

title: The Weeknd makes a winning comeback with 'Hurry up Tomorrow'
summary: Innovative, masterful and cinematic, the Canadian singer's sixth album features guest appearances from Lana del Rey, French duo Justice and rappers Travis Scott, Future and Playboi Carti.

title: Hamas, Israel set for fourth Gaza ceasefire swap
summary: Gaza militants, since the truce began January 19, have released 15 hostages after holding them in captivity since their attack on Israel on October 7, 2023. In return, Israel will release 183 prisoners, the Palestinian Prisoners' Club advocacy group said, more than double the initially reported figure of 90.

title: 'In Germany, young people face limited job prospects and little chance of moving up'
summary: Young Germans are increasingly voting for the far right. One of the keys to stemming this shift is to work on raising the rate of social mobility, which is one of the lowest among OECD countries, argues Dalia Marin, a professor of economics in Munich.

title: A medical plane carrying a child patient and 5 others crashes in Philadelphia, setting homes ablaze
summary: The child had been treated in Philadelphia for a life-threatening condition and was being transported home to Mexico, according to Jet Rescue spokesperson Shai Gold, who said this was a seasoned crew and that everyone involved in these flights goes through rigorous training.

title: Tariffs: Trump on the road to a trade war with Canada, Mexico and China
summary: The introduction of 25% tariffs against its neighbors and 10% against Beijing, effective February 1, has been confirmed by the US president. He also announced sectoral tariffs and sanctions against the European Union.

title: Wales is intoxicated by its mining past
summary: Owing its industrialization to coal, its mining has shaped the destiny of this small nation of 3.1 million inhabitants. But today, the Welsh valleys are threatened by the massive pollution generated by mines, causing cancer and asthma among the population.

title: Freezing international aid weakens the US
summary: Donald Trump's decision to instantly block thousands of food and health programs risks having consequences for the very defense of his country's interests.

title: Fine art and haute couture mingle at the Louvre
summary: Paris' Louvre Museum has juxtaposed its collections of decorative art and dresses by designers and fashion houses. Running until July 21, this exceptional exhibition also features rarely-seen rooms of the museum.

title: Horst Koehler, German ex-president and IMF chief, dead at 81
summary: An economist by training, Koehler was the first German head of state who was not a career politician. Before becoming president he was the head of the IMF in Washington from 2000 to 2004 and also held other roles in the civil service and banking.

title: At least 56 killed as fighting grips greater Khartoum
summary: Sudan's regular army and the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces have been locked in a battle for power since April 2023 that has intensified this month as the army fights to take all of the capital.

title: Hamas and Israel complete fourth Gaza ceasefire swap
summary: Hamas freed three Israeli hostages in exchange for more than 180 Palestinian prisoners, released from Israeli custody, in the fourth such swap under a ceasefire deal aimed at ending the war in Gaza.

title: Mexico remains cautious after Donald Trump announces tariffs
summary: On January 31, the US announced it would impose 25% tariffs on the country the following day. The government is expecting difficult negotiations with its North American partner.
